snippet: After the bank declined to cut interest rates or take other stimulus steps, its president described the euro zone as an “island of stability.’'
abstract: European Central Bank again decides to hold interest rates steady, announcing no new action to stimulate the still ailing euro zone economy; president Mario Draghi describes euro zone as an 'island of stability,' giving a slightly more upbeat view of region's growth and downplaying risks of deflationary rut.

byline.contributor: Jenny Anderson contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: After the bank declined to cut interest rates or take other stimulus steps, its president described the euro zone as an “island of stability.’'

headline.main: European Central Bank Holds Rates Steady
headline.print_headline: No New Cut; Rates Again Hold Steady in Europe
